meanings.definition: A large or abundant quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: There were plenties of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She had plenties of time to finish her homework.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had plenties of sandwiches for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with plenties of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The store offered plenties of options for customers to choose from.

meanings.definition: A state of having more than enough of something.
meanings.sent1: After the harvest, they had plenties of food stored for winter.
meanings.sent2: She felt content in the plenties of love surrounding her.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing sink was a clear sign of plenties of dirty dishes.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed in the room, filling it with plenties of joy.
meanings.sent5: The successful business had plenties of profits to reinvest.
